intro: Euzomum vesicarium, commonly known as the blister bladder, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its bladdery, inflated stems that store water, aiding in its survival in dry environments. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. The plant's unique structure and adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study in desert ecosystems.
